result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven E Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven E Bailey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven E Bailey was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Continue with therapy and treatment until comleted thru phase 4 of program.  No contact w/the victim or the family of the victim.  No contact w/children under the age of 18 years of age without prior approval of the agent - except his own children.  Electronic montoring as deemed necessary by the department. Register as a sex offender for his life time.  Follow sex offender rules as set forth by probation agency.   Counseling as deemed necessary by agent. Apology letter to the victim if agent feels necessary.   DNA sample unless already done.  Follow all rules and conditions as set forth by the probation agency.

timeConds.notes: w/huber on or before July 31st, 2017 @ 9:00 am  Not opposed to transferred to Oneida County

Defendant Steven E Bailey in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Notice was given to the victim of this hearing.  If victim does not appear state to read the victim impact statement.  Arguement to be heard due to the length of probation.   Stacey Bailey makes a statement to the court.  Back on the record at 11:16 am

Court orders:
15 years probation w/held sentence not opposed to tranfer to Oneida County
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
one year jail w/huber on or before July 31st at 9:00 am  - not opposed to transfer to Oneida County
Continue with therapy and treatment until completed thru phase 4
No contact w/the victim or the family of the victim

Sentencing hearing on July 25, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven E Bailey in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 10:59am case called - Statements by Attorney Bayne-Allison - Victim will not be appearing today - Defendant will be entering a plea guilty to count 1 - Counts 2 & 3 dismissed  - Agreement recited - Statements by Attorney Chirafisi - Court has reviewed sentencing memorandum - PSI is not requested by parties -  Court would like to put on for 1 1/2 - 2 hours for sentencing - Off record for defense to discuss with defendant - Plea guilty to count 1 - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Court advises defendant of restrctions that go along with a felony conviction - Defendant will have to register as a sex offender -Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court of count 1 - Counts 2 & 3 dismissed - Court would like any additional documents filed prior to sentencing (at least the day prior) - Bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing Memorandum
Motion to Seal or Redact Sentencing Memorandum
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Corey Chirafisi appeared.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court gives oral ruling - Court finds statements made by wife are not admissable - Court finds statements by defendant are admissable at trial - Court finds miranda was proper - Court finds assertion of Miranda after point in interview and those statements should be suppressed - No issue regarding consent to obtain note - Statements by Dunphy - Response by Chirafisi - Statement made in vehicle -  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Oral ruling on December 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Fax cover letter
from Defense counsel to Court
From Court to Attorney Chirafisi
Scheduling conference on September 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven E Bailey in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi. Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court called at 9:09 am. Statements by Mr. Dunphy to Stipulation #3 motion in limine- indicates there will be none. Also the stip on the recording, copy made for court, if there is a need that the court would need to hear it. Chirafisi indicates that one statement made by Mr. Bailey on the way to the jail to the officer will be submitted at a later date. Mr. Chirafisi is allowing the statement to be used. Court moves to Motion to suppress statement of defendant- Dunphy and Chirafisi accept motion. Mr. Chirafisi asking Court to listen to the recordings and the Court can decide on what to do. Wife's statements - no objection from Mr. Chirafisi - does think that they are hearsay. Cross by Mr. Dunphy- Statements may be redacted from the wife if the Court can advise and rules on the redaction. Court will listen to recordings - and Atty. Chirafisi will write a brief and the State will also get a brief to the court in two weeks - If more time is needed, parties to let Court know. Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven E Bailey in court with attorney Corey Chirafisi.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
